casebody.data:
Friday, May 11, 2001

MOTION DOCKET

85-1209. State v. Scott.

Cuyahoga App. No. 48609. By entry filed April 25, 2001, this court ordered that appellant’s sentence be earned into execution on Tuesday, the 15th day of May, 2001. In order to facilitate this court’s timely consideration of any matters raised between now and May 15, 2001, relating to the execution of appellant’s sentence,

IT IS ORDERED by the court that the Chief Justice may suspend application of any provisions of the Rules of Practice of the Supreme Court, including, but not limited to, the filing requirements imposed by S.Ct.Prae.R. XTV(1).

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED by the court that service of documents as required by S.Ct.Prae.R. XIV(2) shall be personal or by facsimile transmission.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED by the court that counsel of record for the parties shall supply this court with a copy of any document relating to this matter that is filed in, or issued by, any other court in this state or any federal court, as well as any commutation, pardon, or warrant of reprieve issued by the Governor. A copy of the document shall be delivered to the office of the Clerk as soon as possible, either personally or by facsimile transmission.
